AD33198D8D2D4C84AE2E3B8B3DD98AB4.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

E2CC9C2A67AF4B32A8D6926785805825.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

C2D96040D8CE47AAA6E1BE455F120EFE.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

6CF90BB7233743B48BF839384FF89BE5.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

1A52D270E8E14D269319AB84AF175BE2.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

D0582103666E4E6E9F570800EBE4EFD4.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

C5834B2BD49843A3B9A390BE266D5D03.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

9C029F1B09564C73A559013CF2BCFFEE.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

3215285C384A47D198757BE3BCF16053.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

295C688BCDCB43CA8F4543D3A37BEE0C.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

9AE3AF6624A34E23A291421FFBE0DA0B.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

13F142D5A351497EAB7F6CB14211CB76.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

3DB8F3BB701C47FCBD0771381E76279B.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

3D7666D98292442090F031082248953D.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow? Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

28B14516FB094F1CB69D79A102C5FA47.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

703CF3F2C2924AE48AF537E56140A965.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

11149C3115A74440B795FD74425AA040.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

B54618D49D084B58811BF261C0362A9A.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

2EEEBDF525394A309C56799455DD1777.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

8D5168FF15954BE0B61699D39C2020B4.description: Apply increasingly proficient autobody techniques, work skills and presentation skills.

5DE6B3F3F16D44F4BD5718EA16BD087A.description: Develop an intermediate project utilizing guidelines outlined in Module 32.

444047EF74714043AC38CB3CA23B0BEB.description: Design and carry out an intermediate project with a self-assessment of the specified skills.

1B31315D3AE1452BAF4FBD8794667115.description: Research, estimate and compare the cost to repair a frame versus replacement.

6019835EF76044EBA07F869CCD25D19B.description: Describe “point to point” measurements and use appropriate equipment to gauge the automobile’s reference point.

BF8B9470CAB54532A80874AA3E83D9D1.description: Demonstrate the concept of “XYZ” coordinates (X = length, Y = width and Z = height) of each control point to verify accuracy.

99BB0B23AE124A92B850D0DAA8D18859.description: Identify types of specialized measuring equipment and apply the appropriate procedures to use measuring equipment in autobody repair.

0B682E58A4054E668079B6427AADACBB.description: Research the history of measurement devices used in autobody repair.

66C2B97509894D1D978F27DCAFAFEBCE.description: Assess damaged areas by measuring automobile body dimensions.

380BF72726D04F62B85C1FCCBC430474.description: Practice correct safety procedures such as wearing gloves, long sleeved apparel and eye protection when repairing trim.

67169C8236F643F99334C0FC1F87642E.description: Demonstrate appropriate use of hand and power tools to remove and install trim.

F957D9F2FABE4EF48613975D448C3738.description: Examine an automobile and adjust and service trim accessories as needed.

EEA3C4F6987242DBA8DEEE37CC46A951.description: Identify interior and exterior trim materials and fastening systems (e.g., clips, adhesives, screws) and carry out the process to repair trim including: removing door panels and upholstery parts to access fasteners; removing vinyl, overlays and decals; and, removing weather stripping from all areas of the automobile and installing new materials.

DE268F9738224190B4662D778A4DCEA1.description: Prepare a cost estimate to remove and replace trim.

5980B4BFF64646B39135F65AC8503E53.description: Identify areas of automobile trim needing repair.

DC479A6A97244045AF75F4B6E86142C3.description: Assess damaged areas and carry out repairs to automobile trim.

451AD5678F8D40D29C2EFA6A0A78D7A6.description: Assess the design and organization of the workspace to prevent workplace injuries when conducting panel alignment.

4C9096ED0C8140EBB59E4B5E4AF9E90B.description: Recognize and follow safe work practices when using appropriate hand and power tools to align panels.

0E3BBE26815F40AD9C37827D284A8288.description: Demonstrate proper use of hand and power tools to align panels.

D7BA6592F56340B9BBA288500BDA6A13.description: Determine proper measurements for panel alignment.

3DF456FC5ABB48B194F8B1A1F5562A4B.description: Identify the appropriate corrective action and tools to align a panel (e.g., hood, door, trunk lid, fender, quarter panel).

E76D91A99C8A44A3BA49963EE4DE7A2E.description: Prepare a cost estimate to align a panel.

57AFC6046E08425AA92A1DB415EB7C67.description: Examine panel misalignment issues (e.g., vertical misalignment, loose latches, hinges) that require corrective action.

A5AB3369AB0E4F3D8AE05B69185B73B8.description: Explore the range of corrective work procedures that may be required to align a panel.

672C9D0DEAAE4564BA21C72120A0102C.description: Assess panel misalignment issues and carry out repairs.

B887E3254C3247C1B5ABEBF40DFC97DC.description: Implement a plan to design and organize the workspace to prevent work-related injuries when refinishing and repainting an automobile.

8C887E7E79684644AFCBC980B8EC0402.description: Examine the effects of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) on the environment.

0E7488D13FFE4152A666988AAA50CE9A.description: Practise proper safety procedures such as wearing coveralls, rubber gloves and safety glasses and using an appropriate respirator to apply automotive primers, sealers and paints.

20CB072E35934F4186F6EAD70E5B80DA.description: Apply proper techniques to mask an automobile and describe over-masking and under-masking.

209E0D66531F492588DC8EEF1347EEA6.description: Explain the purpose and method of application of different (e.g., acrylic lacquer, acrylic enamel, polyurethane and base coat/clear coat) types of automotive paints.

98C6FEB0CAAC4BBFA4A93C0185335A07.description: Describe the purpose and method of application of different types (e.g., epoxy primer, urethane primer surface, polyester primer, urethane sealer and acid etch) of automotive primers.

8DA599F59137431FA9286CE1EBD4B725.description: Differentiate between the types of spray booths such as a prep station, downdraft, semi-downdraft and cross-draft used in autobody repair.

88B44208407048CF8718636854EC555F.description: Practice proper techniques and safety procedures to use a spray gun (e.g., siphon and gravity fed), air compressor, air hose and air regulator to paint part or all of an automobile.

EA4B20A856F241269A2FEA2D88ED7D97.description: Describe the use of reducers and thinners in autobody repair.

0D404E479C1846788953F67CC0044BBE.description: Apply proper sanding techniques using the appropriate type of sand paper to prepare the surface for painting.

4F0925AC93DC40FFA8D5F7BDB4E8CA0E.description: Practice proper safety techniques when using a sandblaster for metal preparation.

142195E4EC3742B791BEF6F3FBF7D5DF.description: Prepare an automobile for refinishing by: assessing imperfections on the automobile and ensuring the surface of the automobile is cleaned with a quality wax and grease remover; analyzing the type of paint, previous and current damage such as flaking, peeling, cracking and repainting, rust, damage from acids and other effects of oxidation; featheredging all broken edges, sanding, rough masking, body filling scratches; priming all bare metal areas by removing waves in body work and repriming areas as needed; and, selecting and applying colour coats using a spray paint booth.

9C47BA127F4D4279892699A4C3A38BF6.description: Prepare a cost estimate of the materials needed to refinish and repaint parts of an automobile.

FBE6D76845B84CCDAB8063FE0A3F31FB.description: Estimate technical measurements and determine appropriate procedures and materials to refinish and repaint parts of an automobile.

A3B63A4E25AF44F5BCB663137565E31E.description: Assess damaged areas to refinish and repaint parts of an automobile.

8865B711B1A44F41A67BC41BF9079263.description: Research and estimate the cost to purchase air, hydraulic and electric tools to enter the autobody trade.

17B6F25E124D40C194D25102A6EBC0D2.description: Recognize and follow safe work practices when using air, hydraulic and electric tools.

7E479EA611BB464985B079F9A37EC0CC.description: Maintain and store air, hydraulic and electric tools and equipment appropriately.

9A17A609154146DEAE9C7355F4967007.description: Inspect air, hydraulic and electric tools before use and tag for repair as required.

A7544728B4B94BDCBC87679BEC4C0F75.description: Perform correct procedures when using hand, stationary and power tools for specific autobody repairs.

62D61E124160472B93EBD343CAFCE8E9.description: Describe the safe use of air, hydraulic and electric tools such as pneumatic chisel, air ratchet, impact wrench, air polisher, air sand blaster, blow gun, air metal shears, power riveter, floor jack, safety stand and hydraulic rams and attachments.

8361FB088C364BD785520640A3926BCF.description: Use and maintain autobody air, hydraulic and electric tools and equipment following safe procedures.

8B3B27EF6A7043B9935168030FFD18CF.description: Ensure all PPE is cleaned appropriately.

4CA6BDE1D55747A98129BC8DC90B981E.description: Identify the purpose and proper use and fit of personal protective equipment (PPE) required for welding, including eye protection (lens shades), clothing, hearing protection and footwear while identifying the hazards from which they protect individuals.

DE0A579EA0F84C1F94F84BE507ECE085.description: Perform and analyze a variety of specified welds, including plug weld, spot weld, butt weld and lap weld.

3A661ED82908474798C1F8CA226DC5D9.description: Identify metals and perform preparation and assembly tasks prior to welding.

01D575B1691741C9BD233A69AC8D3FD8.description: Disassemble, clean and reassemble GMAW welder components.

7CCE8903AC254778BCD1949B720C94ED.description: Compare various types of wire and shielding gases used for GMAW.

F42DA19A6CE641AB80B9B3DD7A065EF8.description: Explain the importance of employing correct start-up and shut-down procedures for GMAW equipment including checking and cleaning up the work station.

47CF87B007224DB98DD5D8E7B8A495ED.description: Demonstrate knowledge of GMAW equipment such as nozzles, contact tips, liners, wire rolls, gauges and flow meters, amperage adjustment and voltage adjustment.

96EB0240B0EC4F49991E0CC584935AC1.description: Use gas metal art welding (GMAW) equipment to complete specified autobody welds.

3BAB16CF48EB4B6690976BF508A56140.description: Implement a plan for a safe and healthy classroom and shop environment.

D4E094A37AEF44548B2BA879027E6472.description: Assess the ergonomic design of the work space and implement appropriate procedures to ensure safety.

6F899F2CEA0D43F2B435F3364DACBEDD.description: Apply safe and fair work practices, including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

476357CA49684ADBB66E7C7426AE0530.description: Explain the proper procedures to follow to report a workplace injury.

A3A6CD3C28654926894DB743D6ED6C66.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

111D7D5838214C33AD692AD538641DCC.description: Disconnect batteries and other power sources prior to undertaking autobody repairs where appropriate.

10DDB398CE874A9CB7E7215FDEC6486B.description: Assess hazards and apply appropriate safety procedures when working in a confined space.

E6A29F882C9945F4B8DED0444C30B56D.description: Assess the fire plan for the work area, including components such as fire alarms, fire extinguishers, exits and procedures, and make recommendations for improvements.

0043F0EE28104AD6AB772F3616D49880.description: Identify, label, store and handle hazardous materials according to Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).

9FB24E8847494B7BAA1DCC5B27D23126.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE), including dust masks, approved respirators, coveralls, chemical resistant gloves, eye and hearing protection and footwear.

1BE2F78E416D471F8C3F53FFEAFE830F.description: Apply injury prevention principles to ensure safe work performance in the autobody trade.
